title: 'I got ding-dong ditched': Cat pawrent answers the door to find a box filled with five abandoned kittens, she steps up and raises them
description: Good meowrning, feline friends. We all know how kittens are made, right? Well, if you don't, we'll tell you: when one mommy kitty and one daddy kitty fall in love, they get meowrried, and then a few months later, a stork comes and drops off the kittens in a cardboard box close to where they live. Well, sometimes, the storks get lost, and they leave the kittens with some unsuspecting cat-lover (the storks are obviously employees of the cat distribution system) to take care if instead of mommy and daddy.While cooking dinner one night, this unsuspecting cat-lover went to answer the door and found nothing except a take-out box. Surprised by how heavy it was, she opened the box to find five barely born kittens, some formula, and feeding bottles. Maybe it was a stork, maybe it was a hooman who couldn't take care of them, but they were her responsibility now, and she certainly stepped up. We also included an awwdorable update, so scroll down to see all these seriously smol kittens below!
author: Blake Seidel
excerpt: 'I got ding-dong ditched': Cat pawrent answers the door to find a box filled with five abandoned kittens, she steps up and raises them - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: We don't even know how we would react if this happened to us. Happy? Yes. Concerned? Also yes. But what else can you do with little ones that need you to help them survive? You just keep problem-solving until you get to a place where you can breathe. That's exactly what she did, and she saved five tiny lives because of it. They are growing up into such awwwdorable little babies! If she doesn't keep them, we'll take one. We're sure they'll get adopted in no time. She's not the step-mom, but the mom who stepped up. Let's all give her a big round of appaws!
html:
We don't even know how we would react if this happened to us. Happy? Yes. Concerned? Also yes. But what else can you do with little ones that need you to help them survive? You just keep problem-solving until you get to a place where you can breathe. That's exactly what she did, and she saved five tiny lives because of it.

They are growing up into such awwwdorable little babies! If she doesn't keep them, we'll take one. We're sure they'll get adopted in no time. She's not the step-mom, but the mom who stepped up. Let's all give her a big round of appaws!
